data.title: Immortality Characters
data.meta_description: Whether a character never ages or is invincible, immortality represents the inability to die. Sometimes this is a blessing, sometimes it is a curse. Either way it usually makes for an interesting game mechanic.
data.text:
Algol

Algol, the Hero King, is the final boss in the game Soul Calibur IV, and is the creator of Soul Calibur. Algol wields both Soul Edge and Soul calibur . He is also said to hide ten distinct weapons in his body, like a cannon that forms around his hand.

Alperen

Alperen is the final boss of Dual Blades and Slashers: The Power Battle. He is an immortal warrior who seeks the peace of death.

Ameretat

The Amesha Spenta of longevity in Zoroastrian folklore. She is often associated with Haurvatat, the embodiment of wholeness.

Android 18

Twin sister of Android 17, the only female "Android" (actually a Cyborg in this case) created by Dr. Gero. 18 is absorbed by Cell to transform into his Perfect Form, but is later spat back out. She marries Krillin and they have a daughter, Marron.

Arahan

One of two immortal Wood Elf sisters who diligently serve Ariel of Athel Loren. Should one sister die, they will eventually come back to life, with the other sister going on a vengeful rampage in the meanwhile. Of the two, Arahan is the more arrogant and mean-spirited.

Archdemon Urthemiel

Urthemiel was once one of the old gods of Tevinter before he was corrupted by the darkspawn and became the Archdemon of the Fifth Blight.

Arcueid Brunestud

Arcueid Brunestud is a character from the visual novel Tsukihime. She is also playable in the fighting game Melty Blood.

Ares

A mythological Greek God. Son of Zeus, brother of Athena, Artemis and Apollo. He is the God of War and is unmarried. In mythology he has an affair with Aphrodite. He appears in many different games, most notably the God of War series.

Ariel

The Queen of Athel Loren, Ariel is one of the most powerful wizards in the Old World. She is a demi-goddess and the avatar of Isha, the ancient Elven goddess of nature, and can use Isha's power as her own.

AZ

AZ is a mysterious man who appears in Pok√©mon X and Y. He is linked to past events in the Kalos region.

Be'lakor

Known as both the First Damned and the Dark Master, Be'lakor was the very first mortal to ascend to Daemonhood, but was passed up by the four Chaos Gods as a candidate for the Everchosen. Nevertheless, he is a proud follower of Chaos.

Bryan Fury

Bryan Fury is a character in the popular Tekken fighting game series. He was killed in a Hong Kong shootout, only to be revived by Dr. Abel with the use of cybernetic equipment, effectively making him a zombie cyborg.

C.C.

C.C. (sometimes referred to as double C) is one of the main characters in Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion anime and appears in the games based on it. She gives Lelouch his Geass power, under the condition that he grants her a wish.

Cervantes de Leon

Cervantes is a dual wielding Spaniard swordsman from the SoulCalibur series, an undead pirate who seeks to regain Soul Edge for its unlimited power.

Cromwell

Cromwell is MacKenzie's butler in the Touch Detective series. He is a supernatural being of some sort.

Dante

She is the known leader of the homunculi. The main antagonist of the first anime adaptation of Fullmetal Alchemist.

Deadpool

Thanos was jealous that Deadpool and Lady Death were in love that he cursed Deadpool from ever seeing Lady Death again, therefore making him not able to die, therefore making him immortal.

Demona

Demona is a primary antagonist of the Disney animated television series Gargoyles. She has a complicated history with Goliath and a deep hatred of humanity.
